summary: This bill, the Feral Swine Eradication Act, amends the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 to reauthorize the feral swine eradication and control program. It removes "pilot" from the program's title and operations, expands the definition of eligible areas, and provides funding of $75 million for the period of fiscal years 2025 through 2030. It includes provisions for monitoring eradicated areas and requires reports to Congress and the public detailing program activities, effectiveness, and recommendations for improvement.
